item.title: Abandoned Lewisham and Greenwich bins, 29th September
item.description:
There are several abandoned wheelie bins next to the flats and outside Bridge House. This is increasing becoming a health and safety hazard as the bins are not emptied and get filled with rotten waste including feases. The bins need collecting urgently as it‚Äôs rotting attracting vermin and scavengers. The bins have been abandoned for at least three months by an unknown person. Please üôè have these bins removed as a matter of urgency. Thanks in advance and looking forward to getting this resolved urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping next to bin store at north end of Long Walk, 29th September
item.description:
There is a large amount of fly tipping on the grass next to the bin store on Long Walk - Nightingale Road end. It includes a couple of double mattresses, a large wooden pallet, a number of chairs, a large sheet of plastic amongst other items.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Long Walk, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rough sleepers set up camp, 29th September
item.description:
Hello. People have been sleeping rough here for some time now and are making their camp more and more permanent. They have now tied together a series of bins as a wall and leaving more and more of their belongings. We are scared to walk past at night and approach our bins. There is a constant very strong smell, broken glass and needles left laying around in a family area. Please can you help to resolve this. Thank you very much!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brunswick Quay, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped sofa and rubble bags, 29th September
item.description:
Fly tipped sofa and 2 rubble bags - half in the road and half in the vegetation on Corinthian Road. We come to the hall on this road every Monday and it wasn't here last Monday but is today. This road seems quite bad for fly tipping with old furniture and fridges regularly dumped on the road or pavement. Maybe it's time to get some CCTV covering this road and get proactive about fly tipping since every time it's cleared up it must be affecting our council tax.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bronze Age Way, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree being used to dump dog poo bags, 29th September
item.description:
An irresponsible dog owner using this tree as a dustbin for dog poo bags. These need to be removed. There is a street lamp opposite with multiple cameras attached. Can the footage be checked please to identify the person using this tree as a dustbin and take appropriate action to fine them for failure to clean up after a dog in public. (Dogs (Fouling of Land) Act 1996 and the Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act 2014)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
